**Wikipedia summary**:  
<p class="mw-empty-elt">

<p><i><b>Polypodium glycyrrhiza</b></i>, commonly known as <b>licorice fern</b>, <b>many-footed fern</b>, and <b>sweet root</b>, is a summer deciduous fern native to western North America, where it is found in shaded, damp locations.
</p><p>Spores are located in rounded sori on the undersides of the fronds, and are released in cool weather and high humidity.
